timeline.bodyText: Since we are just lazy loading the components in and don't need to add anything to the page, you might be able to get rid of the AdminUsers.jsx and AdminUserGroups.jsx files and instead import AdminUserGroupsPage and AdminUsersPage.  Then here you would replace AdminUsers with AdminUsersPage and AdminUserGroups below with AdminUserGroupsPage.
timeline.author: deepsidhu85
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,66 @@
+/*
+ * This file renders the details for the admin as well as,
+ * lazily loads the Users and Statistics components (component
+ * is only loaded when the corresponding tab is clicked)
+ */
+
+/*
+ * The following import statements makes available all the elements
+ * required by the components encompassed within
+ */
+
+import { Layout } from "antd";
+import { Router } from "@reach/router";
+import { ADMIN } from "../routes";
+import React, { Suspense, lazy} from "react";
+import { ContentLoading } from "../../../components/loader";
+
+const { Content } = Layout;
+
+import AdminHeader from "./AdminHeader";
+import AdminSideMenu from "./AdminSideMenu"
+import { setBaseUrl } from "../../../utilities/url-utilities";
+
+const AdminStatistics = lazy(() => import("./AdminStatistics"));
+const AdminUsers = lazy(() => import("./AdminUsers"));
+const AdminUserGroups = lazy(() => import("./AdminUserGroups"));
+
+export default function Admin() {
+  const DEFAULT_URL = setBaseUrl("/admin");
+
+  /*
+   * The following renders the tabs for statistics and users,
+   * the components are only loaded if the corresponding
+   * tab is clicked
+   */
+  return (
+    <Layout>
+        <AdminSideMenu />
+        <Layout>
+          <AdminHeader />
+          <Content>
+            <Suspense fallback={<ContentLoading />}>
+              <Router>
+                <AdminStatistics
+                  path={
+                    `${DEFAULT_URL}/${ADMIN.STATISTICS}`
+                  }
+                  default
+                />
+                <AdminUsers

replies.bodyText: I am using these routes to change the URL. The old settings cog had /groups. Should it still be changed in this case? That means the path would then become admin/user-groups when the groups link is clicked
replies.author: paulowenbrown

timeline.bodyText: Can you move this inside the admin directory, want to keep everything specifically tied to the admin in it's own grouping.
timeline.author: joshsadam

timeline.bodyText: The img src needs to be wrapped in setBaseUrl
timeline.author: joshsadam

timeline.bodyText: Try to name your keys after the component they are tied to e.g. AdminPanel.title or whatever the component is.  That way it is easy to track down where it is used.  We have had problems deleting keys that get re-used.  I have also begun using a system that if it is internationalized on the server (e.g. the response from a request), preface the key with server.  just makes it easier to track down.
timeline.author: joshsadam

timeline.bodyText: Don't need `xmlns:layout="http://www.ultraq.net.nz/thymeleaf/layout"\` it is used for doing complicated templating on the main site that I really wish was not there.
timeline.author: joshsadam

timeline.message: Changed Admin.jsx to import UsersPage instead of outdated AdminUsersPage
Modified UsersPage to get it to work with both admins and managers

timeline.bodyText: FYI, and please don't bother changing it this is just a teaching point.  You don't have to include index.js, that is the default file name for js files so if you just had admin: "./resources/js/pages/admin" it would also be valid.
timeline.author: joshsadam

timeline.bodyText: This is kind of ugly.  Can you move the `UsersTable` into it's own file, in the components directory (follow the naming in there for directory names).  Then create a AdminUsersPage that imports that.  The benefit is that it prevents checking the page variable if the user is an admin, you know if they are in the admin section that they must be one.  You can then pass that in as a param into the UsersTable component.
timeline.author: joshsadam

timeline.message: Moved UsersTable to components directory and added AdminUsersPage.jsx
